articles.snippet: The commissioners in college football want to talk about expansion. This is how it always starts. Will it be different this time?
articles.lead_paragraph: The commissioners in college football want to talk about expansion. This is how it always starts. Will it be different this time?

headline.main: Will the Rose Bowl Stand in the Way of a Bigger College Football Playoff?
headline.print_headline: Prickly Issue  In Pasadena:  Expanding  The Playoff

articles.snippet: Frustration for the storied league has played right into the debate about expanding the College Football Playoff.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO — Survey the schools that make up the modern Big Ten, and you find brand-name universities that actually have the football history to back up their bragging.
articles.abstract: Frustration for the storied league has played right into the debate about expanding the College Football Playoff.

headline.main: The Big Ten Missed the Playoff Twice. Is Winning the Conference Enough to Contend?
headline.print_headline: Big Ten Looks for a Way Back Into the Big Picture

articles.snippet: The first College Football Playoff ranking is still three weeks away. Players and coaches say the other polls are intriguing, but mostly potentially season-crippling distractions.
articles.lead_paragraph: DALLAS — Around the time the University of Oklahoma’s spirit squad, the Ruf/Neks, fired its shotguns, it was possible to catch the hoarsely hollered words of two men clad in crimson and cream.
articles.abstract: The first College Football Playoff ranking is still three weeks away. Players and coaches say the other polls are intriguing, but mostly potentially season-crippling distractions.

headline.main: Read the Polls. Debate Them. Definitely Don’t Count on Them.

articles.snippet: A college football game could put a freshly sodded field to the test a day before Minnesota United hosts its first M.L.S. playoff game.
articles.lead_paragraph: BLAINE, Minn. — Every night and every morning for the past three weeks, Chris Wright, the chief executive of Minnesota United F.C., has checked the long-range weather forecast on his smartphone. This is what happens when a drainage problem ruins the playing surface in your team’s new stadium, when it needs to be replaced on the eve of your team’s debut in the Major League Soccer playoffs, and when you know you have double-booked the venue for that weekend.
articles.abstract: A college football game could put a freshly sodded field to the test a day before Minnesota United hosts its first M.L.S. playoff game.

headline.main: At Minnesota United, a Late Substitution for the Playoffs: New Turf
headline.print_headline: In Minnesota, A Substitution Comes in Late: A Fresh Field

articles.abstract: The critical top four spots did not include Clemson,  which is at No. 4 in The Associated Press poll, but did include Penn State.
articles.snippet: The critical top four spots did not include Clemson,  which is at No. 4 in The Associated Press poll, but did include Penn State.
articles.lead_paragraph: Imagine being  a Clemson player when the College Football Playoff committee announced its first rankings of the season on Tuesday night. The Tigers are the defending national champions. They have won 24 consecutive games — including the last four by at least 31 points. They received seven first-place votes in the most recent Associated Press poll.

headline.main: College Football’s Champions Aren’t in Top 4 of the Playoff Rankings. Why?
headline.print_headline: In Playoff Rankings, Champion Is Outside the Top Four

articles.abstract: Louisiana State ended an eight-game losing streak to the Crimson Tide and put itself in the driver’s seat for the College Football Playoff.
articles.snippet: Louisiana State ended an eight-game losing streak to the Crimson Tide and put itself in the driver’s seat for the College Football Playoff.
articles.lead_paragraph: TUSCALOOSA, Ala. — Somewhere down in the bayou, you can be certain that candles were lit, Hail Marys were paired with bloody marys and gris-gris were lovingly caressed again on Saturday afternoon. It is the way they mark Alabama day during the college football season.

headline.main: ‘An Overwhelming Feeling’: L.S.U. Solves the Alabama Puzzle
headline.print_headline: ‘An Overwhelming Feeling’: L.S.U. Finally Solves the Alabama Puzzle

articles.abstract: L.S.U. took over the top spot in the College Football Playoff rankings. Computer rankings and bookmakers beg to differ.
articles.snippet: L.S.U. took over the top spot in the College Football Playoff rankings. Computer rankings and bookmakers beg to differ.
articles.lead_paragraph: L.S.U. this week took over the top spot in the College Football Playoff rankings. And why not? The team is 9-0 and just beat previously undefeated Alabama, 46-41.

headline.main: Who’s Really No. 1? Maybe Ohio State
headline.print_headline: Forget the Playoff Ranking. Computers Like Ohio State.

articles.abstract: A win over Georgia on Saturday should be a strong argument for making the Tigers the playoff’s top seed, ahead of Ohio State, but will the committee see things that way?
articles.snippet: A win over Georgia on Saturday should be a strong argument for making the Tigers the playoff’s top seed, ahead of Ohio State, but will the committee see things that way?
articles.lead_paragraph: Once upon a time, there would be little argument about whether a team that blew through the Southeastern Conference unbeaten should be anointed as the best in the country. But Louisiana State may have to do more than just dispatch Georgia in the SEC championship game on Saturday night to earn the top seed in the College Football Playoff.

headline.main: For L.S.U., a Lot of Love in Polls, Not So Much in Playoff Rankings
headline.print_headline: L.S.U. Holds Steady at No. 1, but So Does Ohio State

articles.abstract: Louisiana State dominated fourth-ranked Georgia from the outset, and Joe Burrow made his case to lock up the Heisman Trophy.
articles.snippet: Louisiana State dominated fourth-ranked Georgia from the outset, and Joe Burrow made his case to lock up the Heisman Trophy.
articles.lead_paragraph: ATLANTA — The Southeastern Conference title game was less than three minutes old when the Louisiana State offense stormed onto the turf and started a pair of closing arguments on Saturday. One was to demand the College Football Playoff’s top ranking. The other was for the Tigers’ quarterback, Joe Burrow, to win the Heisman Trophy.

headline.main: L.S.U. Makes Case for Top Seed in Playoff With SEC Win
headline.print_headline: L.S.U. and Its Quarterback Put Together Efforts Deserving of Top Billing

articles.abstract: Utah, ranked fifth by the committee that decides the playoff, was upended by Oregon in the Pac-12 Conference title game, 37-15.
articles.snippet: Utah, ranked fifth by the committee that decides the playoff, was upended by Oregon in the Pac-12 Conference title game, 37-15.
articles.lead_paragraph: SANTA CLARA, Calif. — Lil’ old Utah, the Little Engine That Could of college football, had emerged from the shadows of the Wasatch Mountains to take a rare turn on center stage Friday night, eager to impress the College Football Playoff selection committee and maybe — just maybe — earn a spot alongside the behemoths of Ohio State, Louisiana State and Clemson.

headline.main: Utah Had a Shot at the College Football Playoff. Oregon Spoiled It.
headline.print_headline: The Utes Had a Shot at the Playoff. Then the Ducks Came Back to Life.

articles.abstract: The Buckeyes needed a comeback to beat Wisconsin for the conference title. But Clemson and, potentially, Louisiana State in the College Football Playoff are much tougher matchups.
articles.snippet: The Buckeyes needed a comeback to beat Wisconsin for the conference title. But Clemson and, potentially, Louisiana State in the College Football Playoff are much tougher matchups.
articles.lead_paragraph: INDIANAPOLIS — The uncertainty for unbeaten Ohio State going into the Big Ten championship game wasn’t about whether the Buckeyes needed to beat Wisconsin to make the College Football Playoff. It was about what they could showcase for the Playoff’s committee as they made a final push for the top seed.

headline.main: Ohio State Struggled in the Big Ten Title Game. Tougher Teams Await.
headline.print_headline: Could Buckeyes’ Struggle Be a Playoff Harbinger?

articles.abstract: A reawakened fan loves the regular season, but says the playoff is more arbitrary invitational than actual tournament.
articles.snippet: A reawakened fan loves the regular season, but says the playoff is more arbitrary invitational than actual tournament.
articles.lead_paragraph: The end of the American calendar sports year features a festival of college football bowl games that fill television airwaves — if not attendant stadiums — and since 2014 a four-team playoff to determine which of the blessed chosen gets to shout from a mountaintop that is, arguably, mythical.

headline.main: End of the Year Means Another Contrived College Football Playoff

articles.abstract: The four teams in Saturday’s games are the best field assembled in the six seasons of the playoff format.
articles.snippet: The four teams in Saturday’s games are the best field assembled in the six seasons of the playoff format.
articles.lead_paragraph: Critics of the College Football Playoff system, now in its sixth year, often lament its made-for-TV artificiality, its subjective selection process and the role it has played in widening the gap between the sport’s haves and its have-nots.

headline.main: College Football Playoff Offers Its Strongest Semifinals Yet
headline.print_headline: 3 Unbeaten Teams, 4 Heisman Finalists: Strongest Semifinals Yet

articles.abstract: The Clemson quarterback took the Tigers 94 yards in four plays late in the fourth quarter to defeat Ohio State, 29-23, in the semifinal of the College Football Playoff.
articles.snippet: The Clemson quarterback took the Tigers 94 yards in four plays late in the fourth quarter to defeat Ohio State, 29-23, in the semifinal of the College Football Playoff.
articles.lead_paragraph: GLENDALE, Ariz. — As Ohio State quarterback Justin Fields planted to throw, he saw Chris Olave cutting toward the goal post, trailed by Clemson safety Nolan Turner, just as he had on an earlier fourth-quarter touchdown pass.

headline.main: Trevor Lawrence Puts Clemson Back in the National Championship Game
headline.print_headline: Clemson Rallies to Remain Unbeaten and Set Up Title Defense

articles.abstract: The College Football Playoff contenders have often sidelined their punters as they chased first downs. But punting and field position will be important on Saturday night.
articles.snippet: The College Football Playoff contenders have often sidelined their punters as they chased first downs. But punting and field position will be important on Saturday night.
articles.lead_paragraph: SCOTTSDALE, Ariz. — Pity the plight of college football’s modern-day punter. With high-flying offenses proliferating and analytics dictating that teams try to convert more fourth downs rather than give the ball away, punters on the best teams in college football have fewer chances than ever to make their mark.

headline.main: Can They Kick It? Yes They Can. Ohio State and Clemson Just Don’t.
headline.print_headline: Fiesta Bowl May Offer Rare Views Of Punters

articles.abstract: Louisiana State easily blew past Oklahoma in their College Football Playoff semifinal, 63-28, earning a spot in the Jan. 13 championship game.
articles.snippet: Louisiana State easily blew past Oklahoma in their College Football Playoff semifinal, 63-28, earning a spot in the Jan. 13 championship game.
articles.lead_paragraph: ATLANTA — Top-ranked Louisiana State arrived with a hunch: 45 points would be enough to beat Oklahoma in a College Football Playoff semifinal on Saturday.

headline.main: Joe Burrow Threw 7 Touchdowns. And That Was Just L.S.U.’s First Half.
headline.print_headline: L.S.U. Steamrolls Oklahoma to Reach National Title Game

articles.abstract: L.S.U. had college football’s best offense this season. Clemson, the defending national champion, had the best defense. They’ll settle which one matters more in a title showdown on Jan. 13.
articles.snippet: L.S.U. had college football’s best offense this season. Clemson, the defending national champion, had the best defense. They’ll settle which one matters more in a title showdown on Jan. 13.
articles.lead_paragraph: ATLANTA — It is fast becoming a season defined by high-profile firsts for the College Football Playoff.

headline.main: L.S.U. and Clemson Reached the Championship on Opposite Tracks
headline.print_headline: When No. 1 Meets No. 1, Something Has to Give

byline.original: By Alan Blinder and Billy Witz
